unnormalised: The monsoon had just broken in Mumbai, and like everyone else, I, Rohan Verma, was feeling the pinch. My small business, a tiffin service catering to office-goers in Bandra, was facing a slump. The rains meant fewer people venturing out, and the rising prices of vegetables were eating into my already thin margins. I needed a solution, and fast. That's when I started exploring different avenues for securing a business loan. I heard good things about Mudra loans from my friend Suresh.
normalised: The monsoon had just broken in Mumbai, and like everyone else, I, Rohan Verma, was feeling the pinch. My small business, a tiffin service catering to office-goers in Bandra, was facing a slump. The rains meant fewer people venturing out, and the rising prices of vegetables were eating into my already thin margins. I needed a solution, and fast. That's when I started exploring different avenues for securing a business loan. I heard good things about Mudra loans from my friend Suresh.

unnormalised: The first bank I approached was SBI, my current bank. Their loan officer, Mr. Desai, asked for a mountain of paperwork. GST returns for the last 3 yrs, income tax filings, projected revenue, collateral worth at least 150% of the loan amount – it felt like a never-ending list. I needed Rs. 2 lakh to tide me over and invest in some marketing, but the bureaucracy was stifling. I also checked with HDFC bank, but the rate of interest, approx. 12.5% per annum, seemed too steep for my small operation.
normalised: The first bank I approached was S-B-I, my current bank. Their loan officer, Mister Desai, asked for a mountain of paperwork. G-S-T returns for the last three years, income tax filings, projected revenue, collateral worth at least one hundred and fifty percent of the loan amount – it felt like a never-ending list. I needed rupee two lakh to tide me over and invest in some marketing, but the bureaucracy was stifling. I also checked with H-D-F-C bank, but the rate of interest, approximately twelve point five percent per annum, seemed too steep for my small operation.

unnormalised: Then, I stumbled upon an online advertisement for a fintech company called "EasyLoan." They promised quick disbursal and minimal paperwork. Skeptical, I still decided to check them out. Their website claimed an interest rate starting from 9.99% and approval within 48 hrs. I filled out their online application, providing my PAN card number and Aadhaar details. Within a day, I received a call from their representative, Aisha.
normalised: Then, I stumbled upon an online advertisement for a fintech company called "EasyLoan." They promised quick disbursal and minimal paperwork. Skeptical, I still decided to check them out. Their website claimed an interest rate starting from nine point nine nine percent and approval within forty eight hours. I filled out their online application, providing my P-A-N card number and Aadhaar details. Within a day, I received a call from their representative, Aisha.

unnormalised: Aisha was efficient and helpful. She explained the different loan options, and I opted for a short-term loan of Rs. 200000 with a repayment tenure of 18 months. The processing fee was Rs. 3000 + GST. It was still high, but considerably less than the hassle at SBI. She asked me to upload scanned copies of my bank statements for the last 6 months and my business registration certificate.
normalised: Aisha was efficient and helpful. She explained the different loan options, and I opted for a short-term loan of rupee two lakh with a repayment tenure of eighteen months. The processing fee was rupee three thousand plus G-S-T. It was still high, but considerably less than the hassle at S-B-I. She asked me to upload scanned copies of my bank statements for the last six months and my business registration certificate.

unnormalised: Two days later, I received an email confirming the loan approval. The amount was credited to my account the next day. I quickly preponed my marketing plans and began advertising my tiffin service on social media and in local newspapers. Within a week, I started seeing a noticeable increase in orders. The loan had given me the breathing room I desperately needed. I am paying an EMI of approx. Rs. 12000 now.

unnormalised: The rain is still pouring outside, but inside, I am smiling. My tiffin service is back on track, and I am diligently repaying the loan. The experience taught me a valuable lesson: sometimes, the most unconventional paths lead to the best solutions. And remember to always read the fine print before signing any loan agreement! Next step, expand to a new location with a loan of ₹5,00,000.
